Package fi.abo.kogni.soile2.datamanagement.utils

Class CheckDirtyMap<K,T>

java.lang.Object
fi.abo.kogni.soile2.datamanagement.utils.CheckDirtyMap<K,T>
public class CheckDirtyMap<K,T> extends Object
A Map that provides timestamped data obtained with a given retriever, which is used to fill in the data. Map further makes use of indication that a certain element is dirty before returning it. Returning elements can thus take a bit longer but we can handle elements that are mutable bu need quite some data
Author:
Thomas Pfau

    • getData

      public void getData(K itemID, io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.core.AsyncResult<T>> resultHandler)
      Handle an item with the given key by the given result handler
      Parameters:
      itemID - the ID of the item
      resultHandler - the handler that handles the retrieved data

    • getData

      public io.vertx.core.Future<T> getData(K itemID)
      Get an item with a specific key. The Map tries to retrieve it if it can't be found. If it can't be found the handler has to handle a failedFuture with a NoSuchElementException error
      Parameters:
      itemID - the id of the item to retrieve
      Returns:
      the item to be looked for. or null, if it doesn't exist.

    • getDirtyData

      public io.vertx.core.Future<T> getDirtyData(K itemID)
      Get an item with a specific key. This item can be "dirty" i.e. not up to date. Use with care! If it can't be found the handler has to handle a failedFuture with a NoSuchElementException error
      Parameters:
      itemID - the ID of the item to retrieve
      Returns:
      the item to be looked for. or null, if it doesn't exist.

    • cleanElement

      public void cleanElement(K ItemID)
      Maanually clean an element from the Mapping.
      Parameters:
      ItemID - the ID of the item to retrieve
